channel.title: Chinook Pilot Takes A Headshot, Then Flies Home
channel.description:
http://jalopnik.com/5665722/chinook-pilot-takes-a-headshot-then-flies-home
Anyone got any similar stories, I laughed a lot at the comments section on this one ;D
The journalist looks like he only realises he's been in a war zone at the end of the film.
It's shit that I'm automatically disqualified from RAF Piloting just because I've had spinal fusion surgery. Flying a plane or helicopter would be quite awesome, especially evacuating soldiers and the likes.

Look at the end of the video, the reporter basically starts crying and tells them to turn off the camera. Pants were soiled.

theres one from the start of the iraq war when there was a RAF lynx supporting ground troops it was loaded with Helfires or somethin and it was going up against many iraqi tanks and taking rounds… They still decided to stay despite the high chance of being hit by an enemy tank round just to support the ground troops

item.title: Chinook Pilot Takes A Headshot, Then Flies Home
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Jalopnik

Chinook Pilot Takes A Headshot, Then Flies Home

Watch as the British pilot of this Chinook takes multiple hits, including a glancing shot to his own head, on a troop extraction run in Afghanistan. This is the definition of a hero.

Anyone got any similar stories, I laughed a lot at the comments section on this one ;D

The journalist looks like he only realises he’s been in a war zone at the end of the film.

It’s shit that I’m automatically disqualified from RAF Piloting just because I’ve had spinal fusion surgery. Flying a plane or helicopter would be quite awesome, especially evacuating soldiers and the likes.

Read full topic
item.source: Chinook Pilot Takes A Headshot, Then Flies Home
